default: (a) {@item Studded Leather Armor|xphb} or (b) {@item Leather Armor|xphb}, {@item Light Crossbow|xphb} with 20 {@item bolt|xphb|Bolts} and a {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|xphb}.
(a) a {@item Scholar's Pack|xphb} or (b) an {@item Explorer's Pack|xphb} or (c) a {@item Priest's Pack|xphb}

classFeature.name: Death's Companion
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
Even those who dabble in undeath need a companion.
You learn the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} which you are able to cast without Material requirements.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
The only familiar you can find however is a {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM}

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
You have learned to channel the energy of your spiritual guides and embrace the power of storms.
{@i {@b Cantrips:}} You know two {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|Cantrips} at Level 1 selected from the {@filter Necromancer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Necromancer (KYVN)}.
{@i {@b Spell Slots:}} The leveling table above shows your spell slots for Level 1+ spells, you regain spell slots on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@i {@b Prepared Spells of Level 1+:}} You prepare the list of Level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the {@filter Necromancer spell list|spells|level=1|class=Necromancer (KYVN)}.

{@i {@b Changing Your Prepared Spells:}} When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your list of Prepared Spells, replacing any other Necromancer spells for which you have spell slots.
{@i {@b Spellcasting Ability:}} Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Necromancer spells.
{@i {@b Spellcasting Focus:}} You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} for your Necromancer spells.

classFeature.name: Absorb Death
entries: {@i 2nd-level feature}
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@i {@b Material:}} 1 {@item Bone|KyvumsNecromancer|Bone}
You can perform a dark ritual for 1 minute to absorb the remaining life force from a creature's remains.
At the end of it, you regain expended Necromancer spell slots but no more than a number equal to half your maximum (round up).
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 3rd-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 6th-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Soul Link
entries: {@i 9th-level feature}
You are able to use the remaining life force from a freshly deceased corpse to form a link of vitality with your {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} from the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell.
The corpse must be from a creature that was living and thus cannot be a Construct or Undead.
Your {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} Familiar's hit points are now linked with yours and it can never take above it's maximum hit points in damage.
Additionally, your {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} Familiar's damage is increased by an amount equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 10th-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Essence Rip
entries: {@i 11th-level feature}
Necromantic spells that you cast drain the very essence of a living creature's being.
Your Necromancy spells that deal damage to the living deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Necromantic Knowledge
entries: {@i 13th-level feature}
Your study of the Necromantic arts has led to a fruitful discovery.
You can learn two Necromancy spells of your choice from any spellbook of 7th Level or lower.
You are able to change the spell choice upon leveling up.
You are able to cast one of these spells once without expending a spell slot per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 14th-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Soul Recovery
entries: {@i 14th-level feature}

Using the corpse of a recently living creature, you are able to restore one use of your spell from {@classFeature Necromantic Knowledge|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|13|KyvumsNecromancer|Necromantic Knowledge}.
The corpse must be from a creature that was living and thus cannot be a Construct or Undead.
You are also only able to do this twice per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Undeath's Discovery
entries: {@i 17th-level feature}
You have further unraveled the mysteries of undeath.
The spells from your {@classFeature Necromantic Knowledge|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|13|KyvumsNecromancer|Necromantic Knowledge} feature can now be of 9th Level or lower.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: {@i 19th-level feature}
You gain an Epic Boon feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Master of Necromancy
entries: {@i 20th-level feature}
You are now able to learn a third spell from the {@classFeature Necromantic Knowledge|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|13|KyvumsNecromancer|Necromantic Knowledge} feature.
Additionally you can use the {@classFeature Soul Recovery|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|15|KyvumsNecromancer|Soul Recovery} feature a third time before needing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bodies and Bones
entries: {@i 3rd-level Reanimation feature}
You learn the {@spell Reanimate Bones|KyvumsNecromancer} spell. You can cast this spell once per {@variantrule Long Rest} or use any Spell Slot.
Upon defeating an enemy that has bones, spend 10 minutes and roll {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier, you collect that many {@item Bone|KyvumsNecromancer|Bones} from the corpse.
You control an amount or size of creatures dependent on the amount of bones used as per the Class Progression Table.

subclassFeature.name: Flesh on Bone
entries: {@i 6th-level Reanimation feature}
You learn the art of moulding, binding and animating flesh to bone.
Using the corpse of a creature that has flesh, you are able to bind the flesh to one of your controlled Reanimated Bones.
This process will take you 10 minutes.
A Reanimated Bone that has this effect applied will receive an additional 1 hitpoint per size category per Necromancer Level.

subclassFeature.name: Armor of Bone
entries: {@i 10th-level Reanimation feature}
You learn to animate bone as if it were a moving carapace to protect yourself or one of your animated creatures.
Requires {@status Concentration}.
{@i {@b Range:}} 60ft.
{@i {@b Duration:}} 8 hours
You can have up to 8 Bones worth of Armor of Bone active at any time.
The Armor of Bone will be destroyed if the creature it's protecting dies, you lose {@status Concentration}, it's duration expires or move out of range of the Armor of Bone.
If destroyed, none of the bones are salvageable.
Depending on how many bones you animate you can create carapace of different strengths:

items: {@i {@b 2 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Ring Mail|XPHB}
{@i {@b 4 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Chain Shirt|XPHB}
{@i {@b 6 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Chain Mail|XPHB}
{@i {@b 8 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Splint Armor|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Muscle and Mass
entries: {@i 14th-level Reanimation feature}

When binding Flesh to Bone as per the {@subclassFeature Flesh on Bone|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Reanimation|KyvumsNecromancer|6|KyvumsNecromancer|Flesh on Bone} feature you are now able to also bind muscle to one of your reanimations.
This grants the reanimation a bonus additional 5 feet of movement.
Additionally the creature now gains 2 hitpoints per size category per Necromancer level instead of 1.

subclassFeature.name: Hexmaster
entries: {@i 3rd-level Curses feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Hex|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Hex|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Hexes and Curses column in the Class Progression Table.

{@i {@b Harrowing:}} Additionally the {@spell Hex|XPHB} spell's damage die becomes a {@dice 1d8} and can be triggered by anyone attacking the target. However it can now only be triggered once per turn.
This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above level 1.

subclassFeature.name: Cursemaster
entries: {@i 6th-level Curses feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Class Progression Table.
Your {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell always applies it's damage element as well as one of the other options of your choice.

Additionally {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} gains the benefits of {@i {@b Harrowing}} from your {@subclassFeature Hexmaster|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Cursing|KyvumsNecromancer|3|KyvumsNecromancer|Hexmaster} feature with a damage die of {@dice 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Plague Spreader
entries: {@i 10th-level Curses feature}
Your hexes spread to enemies near the afflicted liked a plague.

If a creature afflicted by either of your {@spell Hex|XPHB} or {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spells ends it's turn within 5ft of a creature it considers an ally, that creature is also afflicted by the spell.
A maximum of three creatures can be afflicted by either of your {@spell Hex|XPHB} or {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell at any time.

subclassFeature.name: Deathbringer
entries: {@i 14th-level Curses feature}
Creatures afflicted by your {@spell Hex|XPHB} or {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spells are with intense pain as their bodies begin to erode.
At the beginning of each of their turns, any creature affected by one of these spells must make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} or take damage equal to that of the Hex or Curse.

subclassFeature.name: Soulrend
entries: {@i 3rd-level Reaper feature}
Your attacks siphon the soul of your enemies when charged with Necromantic energies.
You know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip, this does not count against your known cantrips.
You can now channel {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} through your weapon, when you successfully hit a target with {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} you additionally deal your weapon's damage.

If your {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} slays an enemy, gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of damage dealt by the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB}. The {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} last permanently until lost through damage.

You gain proficiency with {@filter Medium Armor|items|type=Medium Armor} and all {@filter Reach Weapons|items|property=Reach} and do not incur disadvantage when using {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} with Heavy weapons that also have the Reach property.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Wrath
entries: {@i 6th-level Reaper feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Forbidden Magicks on the Class Progression Table.

If you cast {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} after hitting an enemy with your {@subclassFeature Soulrend|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Reaping|KyvumsNecromancer|3|KyvumsNecromancer|Soulrend} and it dies, you still gain the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Drain and Wither
entries: {@i 10th-level Reaper feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Forbidden Magicks on the Class Progression Table.

Enemies slain by your {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} can be used in place of {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} for your {@subclassFeature Soulrend|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Reaping|KyvumsNecromancer|3|KyvumsNecromancer|Soulrend} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Creeping Darkness
entries: {@i 14th-level Reaper feature}
You gain 60 feet of {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}.
In Darkness you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on your melee attacks.

item.name: Bone
entries: A bone harvested from a corpse.

spell.name: Reanimate Bones
entries: You reanimate the bones of the dead to do your bidding as per the Reanimated Bones stat blocks.
The reanimated bones take the form of a creature of your choice depending on how many bones were used in the ritual.
If two bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Small|KyvumsNecromancer|small} in size.
If four bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Medium|KyvumsNecromancer|medium} in size.
If six bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Large|KyvumsNecromancer|large} in size.
If eight bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Huge|KyvumsNecromancer|huge} in size.

trait.name: Opposable Thumbs
entries: All creatures you create have Opposable Thumbs and are able to wield Simple Weapons.

action.name: Unarmed Attack
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft.
On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d4 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

action.name: Armed Attack
entries: Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier.
On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.

entries: All creatures you create have Opposable Thumbs and are able to wield Simple Weapons.

trait.name: Structured Body
entries: All of your medium reanimated creations are created with a structured body, they are capable of wearing light armor.

On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d6 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.

trait.name: Structured and Solid Body
entries: Your large reanimated creations are not only structured but solid also, they are capable of wearing medium armor.

entries: Melee Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft.
On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d8 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.

entries: Your huge reanimated creations are not only structured but sturdy also, they are capable of wearing heavy armor.
Due to it's size, the armor must be custom ordered and the cost is four times the normal cost, and it weighs twice as much.

On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d10 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).
